case_vignette: A 5-year-old boy presents to the emergency department with a rash. The patient’s parents state that he has been more ill lately. They report that he recently developed a rash on his head that now seems to be spreading to the rest of his body. His symptoms started 3 days ago and have considerably worsened since then. The patient is otherwise healthy. He has not seen a pediatrician nor has he attended general checkup or milestone appointments. The patient’s parents have tried giving him homeopathic remedies including tuber oil to help him feel better with little success. Otherwise, the parents regularly take their child hiking and swimming in outdoor streams. His temperature is 102°F (38.9°C), blood pressure is 106/68 mmHg, pulse is 167/min, respirations are 25/min, and oxygen saturation is 99% on room air. Physical exam is notable for the finding in Figure A. The child appears very ill and confused.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got a rash on my head that's spreading to the rest of my body, and I've been feeling a lot sicker lately.
How old are you?
I'm 5 years old.
Are you experiencing any fever, cough, or runny nose along with the rash?
I have a fever, but I don't have a cough or a runny nose.
When did the rash first appear, and did it start in one area before spreading?
The rash started 3 days ago on my head and now it's spreading to the rest of my body.
Does the rash have any blisters or is it itchy?
You didn't provide me with that information, so I can't say if the rash has blisters or if it's itchy.
Have you recently been in contact with anyone who was sick or had a similar rash?
I haven't been around anyone who's sick or has a similar rash, as far as I know.
Have you had any recent vaccinations?
No, I haven't had any recent vaccinations.
Does your rash look like small red spots that are turning into blisters?
You haven't given me any details about what the rash looks like, so I can't describe its appearance.
Do you have any known allergies?
I don't have any known allergies.
Have you had chickenpox or been vaccinated for it?
I haven't seen a pediatrician and I haven't had any general checkups or vaccinations, so I haven't had the chickenpox vaccine.
Is the rash painful, and have you experienced any loss of appetite or tiredness?
The rash isn't painful, but I've been feeling more ill and confused.
Given that you haven't received vaccinations, are experiencing a spreading rash, fever, and feeling more ill with confusion, have you experienced any headaches or light sensitivity?
I haven't mentioned having headaches or light sensitivity.
Is there anyone who can provide more details about your symptoms or medical history, like a parent or guardian?
Yes, my parents are here and they've been noticing that I've been more ill lately.
Have your parents or caregivers noticed any changes in your behavior or any new symptoms besides the rash and fever?
They've said I appear very ill and confused.
Final Diagnosis: Measles
